issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

---

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
Ten problem został naprawiony w najnowszej wersji rozszerzenia (4.1.37).
Jeśli rozszerzenia nie zaktualizowało się automatycznie, to proszę spróbować je zaktualizować ręcznie.
Aby to zrobić należy przejść do `chrome://extensions/`, włączyć tryb dewelopera i kliknąć przycisk `Aktualizuj` (tak jak na obrazku poniżej).
<details><summary>Obrazek</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/194807996-f6a68141-174b-4d81-9f25-48762f8cf4d5.png)

</details>

Po aktualizacji rozszerzenia strona powinna działać prawidłowo.

Jeśli z jakiegoś powodu rozszerzenie się nie aktualizuje, to proszę spróbować dodać te reguły:
```adblock
filmweb.pl#@%#//scriptlet("abort-current-inline-script", "IRI", "Adblock")
filmweb.pl#@%#//scriptlet('ubo-abort-current-inline-script.js', 'IRI', 'Adblock')
```
do reguł użytkownika.

comment.body:
My ticket.
I have managed to locate the issue and somewhat solve it.
The issue is with the HTTPS filtering. When disabled, it works fine.
I have tried to reinstall the certificate with no change. As a solution, i have added the google.com in the exclusions and now it works.
I would prefer to not have to add sites to exclusion list. Hopefully, google.com is somewhat reputable.

issue.body:
### ATTENTION

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you're using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you're using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SANdwZsqGJk](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DSANdwZsqGJk) ### Comment > Left comments on the screenshots. But... YouTube.com with AdGuard ON used to look just like the screenshots I uploaded with it OFF. I don't know what they did, but I assume they figured out how to block the Block? > > The only site I have NoScript blocking on YouTube, (and didn't change this at all, and you can see the changes) is "doubleclick". I tried turning that to "temporarily allowed," and turned off DuckDuckGo Privacy Essentials, as well as Firefox's built-in Enhanced Tracking Protection, then turned AdGuard back on. Same results. issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://mangahub.io/user/bookmarks](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmangahub.io%2Fuser%2Fbookmarks) ### Comment > when reading a book on that website and try to click next chapter or accidentally click on empty space on the website, it will every few clicks redirect me to a new tab that tries to open porn or circles through 7-8 URLs until something opens. I can see the URL change on top of the tab and the last time it opened a shop for cloths or sth. This time it was blocked (the content) as per the screenshot. My main concern is why the redirects happen at all, this issue sort of happened all of a sudden. I had it before (like a year ago) and it stopped and now its back. Does not happen on my iphone with adguard, which is super weird as it seems limited to the desktop. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
> @yalx
> 
> > В браузере MS Edge, при включенном AdGuard не загружаются некоторые сайты. В Firefox плагин AdGuard работает корректно.
> 
> От настроек зависит?

Разобрался, AdGuard ни при чём. Серией тестов выявил что причина в MS Edge. Ни сброс, ни обновление, ни удаление папки данных не помогали. Решил вопрос только удалением старого аккаунта Windows и настройкой нового.

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://howtowriteabookthatsells.com/how-to-copyright-a-pen-name/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhowtowriteabookthatsells.com%2Fhow-to-copyright-a-pen-name%2F) ### Comment > This annoyance is so rife on the internet, I beg you to do something in AdGuard to curb it. When moving your mouse cursor away from the page, perhaps towards one's browser toolbar, a desperate pop-up appears begging you not to leave. Adguard is powerless against this because they use a javascript lightbox to darken the page and their message sits on top of it. If you use AdGuard to suppress the message (elements) the lightbox element remains. Then you cannot suppress it or interact with the page anymore. So frustrating! ### Screenshots

issue.title: bstsrs.one
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://bstsrs.one/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbstsrs.one%2F) ### Comment Username: @kaylakm2 > i have never had an issue accessing this website to watch tv shows until today. when I entered the website bstsrs.one into my browser, that message about the website being blocked by a content blocker showed up. I thought that was weird so I tried it on my iPhone 13 pro max that also has adguard installed (all the same filters) and the website works perfectly fine on my phone. So I tried my MacBook again and the same error popped up. I disabled my VPN and tried that way and it said safari couldn't find the server. so I turned my VPN back on, and randomly the website loaded on my MacBook with no error. but that only happens sometimes. I noticed that when I tried to load the website on my MacBook that it kept trying to redirect to another website (srsone.top) which is very odd because it does not redirect on my phone, it goes to the website I want (bstsrs.one). and when my MacBook randomly loads the website after switching off and on my VPN, it does not redirect. it goes to bstsrs.one. I'm just confused why this website loads without issue on my iPhone but not on my Macbook. ### Screenshots

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).
